tier2Ability: If a creature succeeds in training an animal, they gain one additional training point and the DC to tame or train a creature is reduced by 3.
Characters who make crafting checks using Artisan Tools may also progress an associated profession using the same downtime. Characters making religion checks gain a +2 to their rolls.

When a character crafts a meal in, they gain a bonus to the meal equal to its rarity +5 C/+4 UC/+3 R/+2 VR/+1 LG. If a character has heat, they may spend 50gp to reduce that heat by one while the fleet is in town.
Characters learning new weapons may spend an additional 25gp to gain 1 more progression towards learning that weapon.

When a character uses a bardic in downtime, they add an addition +1 to the roll. Character with proficiency in Disguise kits can increase their Wage dice for Performing to d12s while the fleet is in town.
Character’s attempting research can pay 50gp to gain a +1 to their research check, up to a max of +5. This must be paid before the roll is made.

The DC for successful gambling increases by 4 instead of 5 while the fleet is in town. Characters proficient in any gaming set may enter a special and spend 100gp to play a special Dunish lottery. They may roll 1d20+1, on a 21 they win a special prize.

Characters can spend 50gp to hire a tutor for the week, allowing them to gain extra progress on learning a tool or language, you still have to use your downtime to train and spend the 25gp it costs. Character rolling for Complications can roll twice and select which result they want to use.
Characters can purchase special fertilizers from the fleet while it is in town. For a list, see the Specialty Facility document.
